text: Robroyston railway station serves the suburbs of Millerston and Robroyston in Glasgow, Scotland. The station is located on the Cumbernauld Line, and is managed by Abellio ScotRail. The station, which includes a park and ride facility and a through road connecting the two communities, opened on 15 December 2019."Construction begins on new Robroyston station" ScotRail article; Retrieved 2018-09-14New Robroyston station opens as rail timetables change BBC News 15 December 2019 It is part of a wider development plan for the local area including 1,600 new houses. There was previously a Robroyston station (and a marshalling yard) at the same location, on the line originally operated by the Garnkirk and Glasgow Railway which later formed part of the Caledonian Railway main line; this operated from 1898 to 1917, and from 1919 to 1956.Robroyston, RailScotMile Bridge (1955), The Glasgow Story ==Services== From Monday to Saturday, there are 2tph to both and . There is a reduced service on Sundays, with only 1tph each way. ==Facilities== The station acts as a park and ride location, with space for 258 cars. ==References== ==External links== * *Video footage of Robroyston railway station.
